args.content:
import Mathlib

variable {X : Type _} [TopologicalSpace X] {A : Set X}

/-- The closed subsets of the subspace `A` (viewed as `Subtype A`) are exactly the preimages
of closed sets in `X` under the coercion `coe : Subtype A ‚Üí X`. Equivalently, they are the
sets of the form `coe ‚Åª¬π' C`, i.e. `A ‚à© C` for some closed `C ‚äÜ X`. -/
lemma closed_subsets_of_subspace_eq_inter_closed {s : Set (Subtype A)} :
  IsClosed s ‚Üî ‚àÉ C : Set X, IsClosed C ‚àß s = (coe : Subtype A ‚Üí X) ‚Åª¬π' C := by sorry

/-- The closure of a subset `S` of the subspace `A` is the preimage under `coe` of the closure
in `X` of the image of `S`. Concretely, `closure (S : Set (Subtype A)) = (coe ‚Åª¬π' (closure (coe '' S)))`,
which corresponds to `A ‚à© closure_X (S)` when viewed as a subset of `X`. -/
lemma closure_in_subspace_eq_inter_closure {S : Set (Subtype A)} :
  closure S = (coe : Subtype A ‚Üí X) ‚Åª¬π' closure ((coe : Subtype A ‚Üí X) '' S) := by sorry
